text:
Bottle with this label, but reads 10º. Black colour, two fingers head with short retenntion, good lace.
Aroma is roasted, coffee, raisins, chocolate, nuts, licorice. 
Full body, sticky palate.Averga carbonation.
Taste of coffee, nuts, chocolate, licorice dried fruits.
Bottle at La Rovira. Black colour with beige head. Chocolate aroma. Sweet, chocolate, vanilla, roasted taste. Medium body.

33cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 12-03-2017.
"VIII Cata RateBeer Asturias".
BBD: not noticed.
Pours black with nice tan head. Moderate head retention, little lacing. Roasty, coffee, nuts, licorice nose, some toffee. Medium body, average carbonation, oily-viscous texture. Taste is quite bitter, roasty, coffee, dry, licorice. Some sweet notes, ends quite dry. Good.
Achocolatada y licorosa, con algo de vainilla y regaliz. Cuerpo medio. Dulce en boca aunque el alcohol se hace presente. Una delicia!! BB 15/11/2018

33cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Dark brown colour with frothy tan head.
Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, licorice.
Taste is roasted malt, sweet, coffee, chocolate, nuts.
Medium body, soft carbonation.

Botella 33 cl VIII cata ratebeer en Cimmeria 12..03..2017. Fcpref 15..11..2018. Color negro intenso con espuma beige Aromas y sabores maltas y cereales tostados algo torrefactos con suaves Vainillas y ligeras maderas. Cacaos suaves. Cuerpo medio fino espumoso algo denso. Bastante buena. Para repetir.

Botella @VIII Cata Ratebeer 12/03/2017. BBD:15/11/18
Color negro, espuma beige, aroma torrefacto, sabor tostado con buenas notas a café, cuerpo denso, agradable.

330 ml bottle. BB 15/11/2018. At the Peders, Copenhagen, Denmark.
Dark reddish brown color with a small tan head.
Roasted malt, licorice, mild smoke and some spices in the aroma. 
The flavor is roasted malt, licorice, mild smoke, hops, some bitterness and sweetness. Strong and flavorsome. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, roasted malt, alcohol, coffee, and a bit of smoke. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol, coffee, smoke, and bread, leading to a dry roasted finish.
Bottle at Salt Horse. Dark brown, brown head. Nose is roasted malts, sweet chocolate, lots of liquorice. Tastes similar. Very nice, like the liquorice, could be more complex though.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a tan head. Tons of licorice, some ash, more licorice, roasty and a heavy bitterness.
A Classic. Nothing to add. Anything I write more is just blah blah blah....

24th September 2016Borefts VIII. Day 2. Keg. Opaque black - brown beer, small pale tan head. Palate is light, dry and crisp. Smooth dry dark malts, mild roast. Modest dark chocolate. Little dark fruits. Airy finish. Standard stuff but notably light for its abv.

Bottle from Salt Horse. Black body with a thin beige head. Faint lacing. Aroma of salted caramel, Coca-Cola and dark chocolate. Flavour of raisin, fig and coffee. Medium to full body with a slick texture. Light fizz. Very smooth for the strength, but not as complex as Id hoped it would be.

Pours a dense thick black, with a short lived tan head. Nose is really interesting - malty, porridgey, milky, maybe a little vanilla or chocolate. Taste is rich creamy malt, rather sweet creamy finish, with brown sugar and some dark malt notes. Palate is very smooth, medium bodied, with gentle carbonation. A lovely sweetie of a beer.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate, roasted, pepper, taste is sweet chocolate, dry, peppery, roasted malts.

Sample at Borefts 2016. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy tan head. The aroma is dry coffee roasty malt, dark chocolate. The flavour is moderate sweet with a refreshing roasty, coffee chocolate light vanilla light alcohol palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Tap @ fermentoren, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, licorice, hops and has a nice bitter finish.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and licorice. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily and soft. 261116

24/IX/16 - on tap @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: n/a (2016-1170) Thanks to the Belgian ratebeer crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear dark brown to black beer, creamy beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. aroma: sweet, malty, grains, soft roast. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet start, malty, caramel, pretty roasted, some coffee, dried fruits. Aftertaste: bitter, hoppy, soft roast, more caramel, coffee.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus, 10%. Black with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquroice and a little vanilla. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little vanilla, caramel, sweet, hop , warming and medium bitter.
Tasted at Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Roasty, bread, chocolate, cream, quite sweet and well balanced.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours black with a creamy brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, wood, licorice, bitter dark chocolate. Flavor is light bitter, light sweet, malty, licorice, caramel, coffee, wet wood, dark chocolate, light alcohol. Medium to full body, average carbonation, light warming alcohol in the finish. 191116

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours pitch Black with a big, creamy, tan head. Aroma has lots of Dark and milk chocolate, vanilla, Dark berries, light licorice, roasty malts. Taste is sweet, smooth, vanilla and a light roasty bitter finish. Velvety full body and an average carbonation. Nice one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bue à la pression au Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Javais dautres choses à faire que de prendre des notes ;)
Sample at Borefts 2016. Black beer, dark brown head. Aroma is malt, not much else. Taste is sweet, malt, light falvours.
I stort sett svart öl med ett givmilt beige skum. Doft av mörk choklad, kaffe och lättare lakritstoner. I smaken tillkommer mer lakrits, fikon och viss alkoholsötma. .
[9/23/16] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2016 in Bodegraven. Day one. Black. Coffee, chocolate, licorice, alcohol. Sweet, bitter finish.
Black with thin head. Aroma and flavour have lots of dark malts. Its rich, oily and full bodied. The bitterness is well balanced.
At BBF, intense dark brown almost opaque,chocolate coffee and some earthy notes, dominant milk chocolate, some bitterness and just a spice tounge, very sweet, oily and tounge coating. Good.
Sampled at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven. Dark brown pour with a thin tan head. Notes of caramel, roasted malts, roasted coffee beans.
Heavy sweetness and a little bitterness; creamy; liquorice. A full, heavy beer. Its a good porter, but not a spectacular beer.

On tap at Borefts 16. Black colour, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, liquorice, cocoa, pumpernickel. Flavour is sweet, malty, soy sauce, molasses, liquorice, pumpernickel, some chocolate, bittersweet finish. Medium bodied.

Thank you for sharing BE & friends RB Crew! Sampled draft @ Borefts 2016. Day 2. Black, little tanned head. Nose is overly umami for me, very bitter, bitter roasted malts, herbal. Taste is very bitter, big roast, umami, grains, low soy sauce. Bitter umami, herbal, soy sauce body. Not too my preference with the big bitterness, soy sauce & umami nots with nothing balancing it.

Draft at Borefts 2016, shared.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear black pour. Chocolate aftertaste. Lovely
At Borefts 2016. Aroma of creamy roast and choco. Flavor has soft creamy malt, chocolate, bitters and a nice smooth finish. Very nice.

Draft at Borefts 2016, Day 1. Black with a small tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roast, caramel. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation. [23-09-2016]

Aroma and flavors: malts with notes of roasted coffee, espresso coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, molasses, licorice, dark fruits. body is full, texture soft, carbonation is low.

van tap @Borefts 2016, zwart met minimale kaki lacing, aroma van geroosterde en gebrande mouten, chocolade, cacao, laurier Smaken even zo, iets dun qua textuur, vanille, niet zo droog als verwacht van een porter, lekkere cacao, redelijke body, lage co2

Draught @ Borefts16: Served in a taster:
Black body, brown head.
Nose of roast, marzipan, chocolate, light vanilla...
Flavours of liquorice, roast, mocha, chocolate, light sticky, bitter...
Aftertaste is soft bitter, liquorice, mocha, light sticky...
Low carbo, light creamy mouthfeel, medium to fuller bodied
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: From tap at Borefts 2016. Aroma is smooth chocolate cake, roast, bit liquorice, big malt. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet with a good roasty bitter finish. Body is full. Quite balanced and drinkable, smooth, excellent.

Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016, Day 1. Very dark brown to black color, average sized beige head. Smell and taste malts, coffee, roast, malt bitter, coffee bitter, quite dry and earthy. Suitable body and carbonation. I quite like it.

(Dry & Bitter / Hoppin Frog Old School Baltic Porter) Tap at Borefts.
Totally black coloured body, small but thick dark brown head with very good retention.
Aroma has nice coffee, notes, dark bitter chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, some floral touches too.
Taste has even more vanilla, more dark and milky chocolate, mocha, well hidden alcohol, light roasted malts and coal.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, slightly sticky on the palate.
Very good, hidden gem on the festival.
Sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Dunkel orange braunes Bier mit geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig süß, Schokolade. Geschmack süß malzig, Schokolade, rote Früchte, Vanille.
On tap at Borefts 2016. Black. Big tan head. Aroma is soapy. Full body, creamy. In flavor, some herbs and ash. Outstanding balance.

At borefts. Roasted cofee, chocolate. Nice caramel choco sweest, some roasted bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

from draft at BBF, poured deep dark brown to light black with a tanned head. nose of charred malts, dark roasted chocoltae, liquorice, smoke, toasted notes, caramel, slight dried dark fruits notes, nice porter

Tap. Dark brown color with amber highlight and a beige head. Aroma is black chocolate, coffee. Taste is more black chocolate, quite dry and a bit chalky. Slightly warming finish. Medium carbonation. Very nice!

Borefts 2016
Beetje wrangige zwarte tonen, licht chocola... relatief lichte body.... ok
Keg at borefts 2016... Dark black.. Thin tan lacing... Soft sweet coffee chocolate Roast malts nose.. Rich Dry chocolate Roast malts... Big bitter roast
Weicher, wenig süßer Malzantrunk. Herb malzig im Mittelteil, intensiv Kaffeenoten. Sehr gelungen. 10/10/10/13//12

On tap at Borefts Beer Festival, De Molen Brewery, Bodegraven Friday 23rd September 2016.   Pours black with a light beige head atop. Soft in the mouth, lots of liquorice and some treacle toffee. Bitterness and roasty its good but then its in good company. A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8

Draught at Fermentoren.
Black colored with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and roasted aroma of licorice and chocolate.
Roasted flavor of licorice, dried fruits, hops and alcohol.
Roasted and hoppy finish.
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted, liqourice and dark malty. Dark malty, chocolate. Toasted, dark malty. Roasted. Bitter, toasted malty. Caramelish malty finish.
From tap at Fermentoren. Black witha beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, bitterness, caramel dried fruit.

Roasted and sweet malty aroma and taste, down cocoa, caramel, treacle, great charged burnt charred malty notes, nice hoppy backing, gorgeous brew!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Fermentoren. Black with a thick and lasting tan head. Aroma of chocolate, licorice and toffee with a touch of dried fruit. Sweet toffee and toasted malt flavour. It shows that one of my favourite black beer breweries is involved
On tap. Black with dark biege head. Malty, nutty, syrupy and its a nice beer.

Brewskival 2016, Saturday. Opaque black beer with a rich lasting beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma, licorice, figs, cocoa powder, coffee notes. Chocolate flavor, licorice, raisins, coffee notes, cocoa, some figs, some warming alcohol. Really nice.
